Yunbin Bae does UX Research / Design to humanize technology and build community engagement by figuring out problems rooted in harmful designs.

currently in Seoul, Korea

UX Projects.

Relief's Map

A UX Case Study on how the spy camera detector application, Relief's Map, offers vague means to understand women's safety from spy cameras in Korea, and even has the potential to abuse women’s fear and learned helplessness on spy cameras. To design for empowering marginalized people, I urge the importance of acknowledging the complexity of oppressed group's social psychology that centers around fear, learned helplessness, and indignation.

Individual Project [Oct 2021~]

UX Research, Ideation, UXUI Design, Interaction Design, User Testing

Case Study

A UX Case Study on how the spy camera detector application, Relief's Map, offers vague means to understand women's safety from spy cameras in Korea, and even has the potential to abuse women’s fear and learned helplessness on spy cameras. To design for empowering marginalized people, I urge the importance of acknowledging the complexity of oppressed group's social psychology that centers around fear, learned helplessness, and indignation.

INDIVIDUAL PROJECT

DURATION: Oct ~ Dec 2021

UX Research, Ideation, UXUI Design, Interaction Design, User Testing
